full_summary:
### **Title: Global Intel Data Subscription**
### **Reference Number:** cb-11-24208720
### **Publication Date:** 2024-03-05
### **Closing Date:** 2024-03-20

The government intends to award a contract for Global Intel Data Subscription services to Investment Property Databank Limited (MSCI). This Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) is published to invite other suppliers to demonstrate their capabilities and express interest in submitting a statement of capabilities.

#### **Scope of Work:**
The scope of work is to provide access to databases on real asset investments for the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions Canada (OSFI).

#### **Trade Agreements:**
The awarded contract will be governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Revised World Trade Organization - Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and others.

#### **Eligibility Criteria:**
To be considered, a supplier must meet the following criteria:
•	Provide investment performance data for real assets investments.
•	Offer multiple user licenses for IPD indices.
•	Present a structured data program to ensure investment performance reporting consistency.

#### **Statement of Capabilities:**
Intersted suppliers may submit a statement of capabilities to demonstrate their capabilities. The closing date is March 20, 2024, at 2:00 p.m. (EDT).

#### **Pre-Selected Supplier:**
MSCI has been selected as the pre-identified supplier due to its extensive private real asset database and robust data methodologies.

#### **Contract Details:**
The proposed contract is for a one-year term, with five options to extend for up to one year each. The estimated contract value is $363,914.72 USD (HST extra).

#### **Contact Information:**
For queries or expressions of interest, please contact Andrew Bryant, Contracting Officer, at andrew.bryant@osfi-bsif.gc.ca.
### **Regions of Opportunity:**
This contract is open to all regions worldwide. However, the services will be utilized primarily in the National Capital Region (NCR).

Please note that the statements of capabilities are to be submitted in writing to Andrew Bryant at the above-mentioned email address. All statements will be evaluated, and successful contractors will be contacted for further communication. Please visit the following links to access the full tender notice in English and French: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/t
